instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D6905: What is D6905? Diode sitting between PPBUS_G3H/PP18V5 charger voltage and PP3V42_G3H power supply input on very old Macbooks(before 2011), can die and cause PP3V42_G3H to be missing and have no input voltage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short
threads.message:
Have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that had water damage. Ran in ultrasonic cleaner but after it would first turn  for a few seonds, turn off then back on. I noticed <DIODE>D6905</DIODE> had some corrosion which I scrubbed off then it would turn on with the fan at high speed, no image on the screen.

After removing <DIODE>D6905</DIODE> I noticed pin 1 and 3 pads are missing from the water damage. Do I need to run a jumper wire from <DIODE>D6905</DIODE> to fix this problem? If so to which part do I run it to?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short
threads.message:
No Title

I cant get solder to stick to the pads I circled

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short
threads.message: With some flux and pre heat you should be able to solder that. Although this will probably not fix the board as bad <DIODE>D6905</DIODE> would cause totally dead board. I see some pretty corroded resistors too....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short
threads.message: Before removing <DIODE>D6905</DIODE> the board was still powering on and the fan was spinning, just no image on the screen. Should I put the board in the ultrasonic cleaner again for the corroded resistors? I have a new <DIODE>D6905</DIODE> to replace the old one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short
threads.message: The fan would just stop spinning for a few seconds after it was turned on before then it would continue spinning.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short
threads.message: I would measure resistors and replace if bad.....
